title: Data Analyst
description: ["Job Description     As we accumulate data from millions of young learners worldwide, we need to understand their learning journey and be able to share the right insight for parents, teachers, schools and school funding organisation.\xa0     You will be part of a global Analytics team supporting local scope and stakeholders. You will be supporting locally various business and product stakeholders by creating reports and dashboards that will be integrated in the KidsLoop platform and products and by providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve the learning process for KidsLoop users and customers in Vietnam. You will work closely with global data teams such as data engineering, data\xa0science and applied science to identify appropriate analytics solutions and provide input on local specifics. As a Data Analyst you will be one of the main contributors to Data Quality and Integrity best practices, supporting data investigation, research and data management, troubleshooting and investigating data anomalies and issues, working directly with the data engineers to follow through and get the issues fixed. You will also assist in building predictive systems to help understand learner behaviour and educator support.  This is a great opportunity for someone who is interested in joining a lean, innovative group with the possibility of tremendous career development in data engineering, data science & analytics and data asset management.  \xa0  Your Skills and Experience     Your Responsibilities  Data collection: identify the data needs and requirements based on business/ product problems; collect data from a variety of sources and define new collection techniques where needed; manage metadata Data management: assess data quality and support data integrity initiatives; handle confidential information responsibly; create mechanisms for exploring structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data Manage local business/ product/ education stakeholders to understand business problems and liaise with a global data\xa0teams to identify appropriate analytical solutions to address them Conduct detailed data analysis/modelling;\xa0identify patterns in data & generate actionable insights from the available information to support business or product decisions Examine trends to generate hypotheses and recommendations to respond to student, parent, teacher, school, organisation, or government needs and goals Design KPIs, diagnostic metrics and benchmarks, including setting effective targets to drive optimal outcomes Create reports and dashboards to share insights with company customers and partners     Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in a field like information technology, computer science, statistics, or mathematics Minimum of 2 years working experience in technical data analysis, data science, or data warehousing with proven business / product analysis experience. Product Analytics experience is a plus Experience working with Big Data/ unstructured data. Strong SQL, experience with python for data analysis. Experience working with cloud data platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure) is a plus Strong analytical skills, translating business problems into analytical questions and creating analytical solutions to address them Strong ownership, stakeholder management and prioritisation skills. Experience working with distributed teams is a plus Strong visualisation skills (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.) Excellent presentation, writing, and storytelling skills are a must Passionate about data and data-driven culture\xa0  \xa0  Why You'll Love Working Here  Competitive compensation with attractive performance incentives Fun energetic team; international & collaborative culture Social insurance, health insurance, unemployment insurance 5 working days per week Opportunities to grow professionally and play a critical role to shape the next stage of the company’s growth Experience the true spirit of a fast-growing and well funded UK EdTech Company.     Show more Show less"]

title: Data Analyst
description: ["Ubisoft Danang is seeking a highly talented, self-driven, detail-oriented Data Analyst who will help us turning data into information, getting insights and developing business decisions based on the analysis results. Your responsibilities will include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design and also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.    Responsibilities    Manage databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality Design game tracking system for technical and game optimization purpose Collect required data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports Retrieve information from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Collaborate with management to prioritize business and information needs Find and evaluate new process improvement opportunities Provide in-depth analytics and insights about our games with interactive Dashboards Develop new insights and analyses that inform decisions and help us continue to delight the people playing our games Coordinate and analyze the efficiency of game events and of some specific game features Create specific reports about new game content profitability using data from diverse sources   Qualifications   1-3 years of experience on a Data Engineer, Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst position Excellent SQL skills: extensive experience querying large, complex data sets A good knowledge of Tableau software A good knowledge in databases/BI Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations Good client management skills with a strong grasp of both technical and business perspectives Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects  Nice to have:    R/Python is a plus Writing the program to extract information from Blockchain sources is a plus.   Additional Information    Why it's great to work at Ubisoft Danang:    An international, professional, collaborative, modern, and creative environment Attractive remuneration package Performance rewards Creative & endless fun projects Unlimited access to Ubisoft games on Uplay Flexible working time Premium healthcare insurance UBIVERSARY for your working milestones Team building, Lunar New year Celebration, Projects celebration Beers and treats every Friday\xa0(yay!) Staff clubs Free in-house entertainment facilities (PS4…), coffee, tea, and fresh fruits\xa0 Show more Show less"]

title: Data Analyst
description: ["GRAB is looking for a Data Analyst (Finance segment) with the detail as below:     Working place: Mapletree tower, Nguyen Van Linh, Dist 7, HCMC  Working time: Monday – Friday, 9:00 – 18:00.     1. Main tasks:  Create, maintain and improve Financial Data Reporting capabilities for the local and regional Regulatory and Compliance reporting for multiple lines of GFG businesses. Gather business requirements and turn them into detailed technical requirements for Finance, Data engineering, Product and Engineering. Monitoring, Influence and Improve products' financial operational performance with BI Tools. Understand and communicate the financial and operational impacts of any changes in Business logic, launch or product across the necessary teams. Influence other functional areas of the business to achieve business objectives.     3. (Must have)  - Proficient in establishing a working relationship with all levels of management & financial and product executives in the region.  - Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.  - Strong problem-solving skills with eyes for details.  - Familiar with ETL & reporting or any mainstream BI tools (Azure Data Factory , Power BI etc.) is a plus.     4. Contact point:  Send your English CV via email: cao.le.yen.nhi@talentnet.vn with title Position_ Full name.  Show more Show less"]

title: Data Analyst
description: ['Mục đích chức danh  Nhận diện các bài toán có tiềm năng ứng dụng phân tích dữ liệu, phân tích nâng cao tại các đơn vị nghiệp vụ trong ngân hàng, đề xuất phương pháp tiếp cận và giải quyết bài toán trong thực tế. Xây dựng chương trình và tổ chức đào tạo để nâng cao kỹ năng phân tích và hiểu biết về dữ liệu cho nhân sự phân tích dữ liệu tại các đơn vị nghiệp vụ trong Ngân hàng, đảm bảo năng lực chủ động giải quyết các bài toán nghiệp vụ của các đơn vị/ bộ phận dựa trên việc phân tích dữ liệu. Mô tả công việc  Tổng hợp và cập nhật danh sách các bài toán nghiệp vụ mà các đơn vị đã, đang và sắp triển khai hoặc có nhu cầu triển khai có tiềm năng ứng dụng phân tích dữ liệu/ phân tích nâng cao, tư vấn phương pháp tiếp cận phù hợp, phối hợp với các đơn vị đánh giá mức độ quan trọng và tính khả thi của từng bài toán nghiệp vụ cần triển khai. Phối hợp triển khai bài toán nghiệp vụ liên quan tới phân tích dữ liệu/ phân tích nâng cao tại các đơn vị; các tài liệu chuyên môn được văn bản hóa đầy đủ, đảm bảo khả năng tiếp nhận sản phẩm phân tích dữ liệu của các nhân sự liên quan. Xây dựng tài liệu, tổ chức các chương trình đào tạo về phân tích dữ liệu, phân tích nâng cao, và lên kế hoạch triển khai phù hợp với các mức độ hiểu biết khác nhau của các nhân sự tại các khối nghiệp vụ trong từng giai đoạn. Nắm vững các kiến thức chuyên môn được chuyển giao từ các đối tác tư vấn trong các dự án thuê tư vấn bên ngoài liên quan tới ứng dụng phân tích dữ liệu/ phân tích nâng cao, đảm bảo tính ứng dụng của các sản phẩm dự án tại Ngân hàng; Thường xuyên trau dồi kiến thức, tự đào tạo và cập nhật các phương thức và xu hướng phân tích dữ liệu tiên tiến trên thị trường. Yêu cầu  Có kinh nghiệm ít nhất 01 năm trong lĩnh vực phân tích dữ liệu; Có kiến thức nền tảng tốt về xác suất thống kê, các mô hình định lượng; Sử dụng thành thạo ít nhất một phần mềm phân tích dữ liệu, xây dựng mô hình như R, Python, SAS, MATLAB,...; Cẩn thận, tỉ mỉ, làm việc tốt dưới áp lực; Ưu tiên các ứng viên có kinh nghiệm tham gia triển khai các dự án liên quan tới phân tích dữ liệu/ phân tích nâng cao tại các ngân hàng thương mại; Sử dụng thành thạo ít nhất một công cụ BI và trực quan hóa dữ liệu là một lợi thế; Có kỹ năng, tư duy lập trình là một lợi thế; Kỹ năng ngôn ngữ và diễn đạt văn bản tốt; sử dụng thành thạo tiếng Việt và có khả năng giao tiếp bằng tiếng Anh. Show more Show less']

title: Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ['Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region\'s largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The candidate is the person in charge for all intelligence/ fraud projects include Commercial & Operational according to C-level plan.  Responsibilities  Perform statistical modeling and analysis of structured and unstructured datasets to develop metrics, reports and visualizations of trends and patterns. Analyze data, draw insights, and present results in a cohesive, intuitive, and simplistic manner to executive management Identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities throughout the data life cycle Mine data, clean data to devise and optimize our algorithms, models’ accuracy Standardize reports, centralize analysis format to enrich our knowledge repositories Training end users on new reports and dashboards Communicate and align with stakeholders on purpose and impact of analytical solutions on business.  Requirements  Data analysis – the ability to assess data sets and identify patterns and opportunities for improvement is the primary skill Presentation skills – is also an important skill as analysis need to present, & make sense of their findings Communication skills – as have to rely heavily on both written and verbal communication to work with departments and personnel across teams and business lines  Working address: Ninja Van Vietnam Office, Tan Binh district, Ho Chi Minh city.  Salary And Benefits  Competitive income compared to the market "Tet" bonus , Performance review from 1 - 4 months Paid social insurance based on full salary 12 days annual leave, 5 days sick leave (with full salary) High-class AON Health Insurance for manager level. Year End Party, annual Townhall Ceremony Annual company trip Attractive team-building activities, regular internal activities Provide laptop for employees  Training And Developing  Participate in internal training courses: online/offline Opportunities to promote to higher positions  Work Environment & Colleagues  Senior leaders are open-minded, respectful and ready to facilitate personal growth Young and dynamic working environment Scope of work is large, the company has more than 6000 employees, the company has operations spreading to 63 provinces/cities throughout the country.  Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice. Show more Show less']

title: Junior Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ["At GeoComply, our mission is to empower the future of digital trust . We operate at the center of a new generation of cybersecurity companies, leveraging today's geolocation data to make better risk-based decisions. Working as a critical piece of the security infrastructure for some of the world’s largest tech companies like DraftKings, FanDuel, the BBC, and Akamai , we are the global market leader for compliance-grade geolocation data and a critical piece of the decision engine. We have big plans in the next few years, including a targeted US IPO and various M&A opportunities.  At the heart of it all is people - we are deeply committed to creating and sustaining a world-class experience for our employees, customers, and partners.  We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our team in HCMC, Vietnam who will match our ambitions , and help us Better ourselves and achieve our goals.  The Junior Data Analyst contributes to GeoComply’s success by providing managers with intel regarding the suspicious cases based on information and data gathered through the back office of our systems. This position reports to DA Lead on a day-to-day basis.  What You Will Be Doing  Perform manual data analysis and visualization on live production data for detection of geolocation data anomalies and anti-fraud purposes Design and script reports based on technical and business requirements Monitor release, configuration, and database changes Contribute to the growth of the team by suggesting ideas and new practices to improve manual review methodologies Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of the company’s technologies, processes, and teams Understand the company’s vision, goals and strategy; actively contribute to the achievement of the goals and execution of the company’s strategy Present the findings and suggestions to the business team Peer review simple findings of other team members.  About You  At least internship experience in a relevant field Bachelor degree with good results in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Information Systems, Finance, Commerce, Economics, Statistics or similar majors Good command in Microsoft Excel Knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL etc), visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Kibana) is a plus Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Enjoy working with numerical data Ability to work in small collaborative teams in a dynamic working environment Good communication and interpersonal skills when working with the team Sound experience in performing both QA testing and data analytics; the ability to look beyond testing tasks and think ‘outside the box’ Comfortable with Android, iOS, macOS, and Windows is a plus Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents (software requirements and design specifications, standards, and regulations). Ability to work under tight timelines Intermediate written and spoken technical English, enough to discuss issues with teams remotely  Our IDEALS  Impact. At GeoComply your voice matters and your work and ideas have a direct impact on our business. Dynamic. We are a hyper growth company with a fast-paced work environment that propels your professional and personal growth. Exposure. We have a flat hierarchy so you work closely with our executives and contribute to projects across teams. Acceptance. We believe in equal opportunity for all and welcome your unique contribution. Learning. We provide extensive training to our people so that you can develop new skills and achieve your career goals. Support. We help each other so that you feel supported and free to do your best work.  Our Benefits  Competitive Salary : High salary and attractive bonus system (13th month, business performance, dividend and internal shares program) Learning & Development : We provide an annual budget equal to 1-months’ salary that can go towards professional or personal development or sport. Equity Plan : As employees of GeoComply, we’re all “owners”. Our unique equity and bonus plans give you the opportunity to share in our company’s success. Fast career path within the company. Premium healthcare insurance (Bao Viet/Liberty) 20 days annual leave Weekly English classes with native teacher Modern stand-alone office building in the center of Saigon. Free motorbike parking. We're always stocked up on snacks and coffee and have free lunches monthly Frequent social and team-building events  At GeoComply, we live our value of building it right. Our workplace is built on mutual respect and inclusion. We know that diversity of experience and thought has led to connection, innovation, and our company’s success. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, beliefs, and identities.  Now What? Send us your resume and a cover letter. We Can’t Wait To Meet You. Show more Show less"]

description: ["Company Description  Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.  Located in Da Nang, Vietnam, a hotbed for tech and culture also known as one of the best cities to live in Asia, the newest studio focuses on developing a diverse catalogue of fun-packed casual genre from instant games to Creation HD PC & next Gen Console games - first to be built and shipped from Ubisoft Vietnam.  By bringing the best creative and engineering talents from Vietnam, SEA and the World together, and allowing them to thrive in a dynamic and modern international work and living environment, Ubisoft Da Nang is the place to be to begin your journey in game development or take the big next step in your career. Your responsibilities will include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design and also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. description: ["Responsibilities And Expectations  Capture and conduct in-depth analysis on social media, PR, and brand health metrics Conduct category research and opportunity assessments across multiple industries, market and media trends, generational behaviors/values/trends, societal/cultural mega-trends Stay current on news of the day and information related to a broad mix of relevant subjects Develop recommendations that answer the client brief based on audit and research efforts Play an active role in conceptualization, research, planning and development of new client campaigns Work with the Planner to write creative briefs, research dossiers, etc. Responsible for managing the research library Juggle multiple assignments and work in a high-pressure environment Manage time and establish priorities while maintaining flexibility to respond to changing demands Professionally and effectively communicate with clients and peers, demonstrating sound reasoning and judgment skills Seek clarity and assistance appropriately Articulate one's role on an integrated team and sets clear expectations for what will be delivered and what information and partnership is needed in order to achieve the mutually desired outcomes   Qualifications  Statistics or Research background At least 2 years agency experience in research and/or social listening Knowledge in quantitative and qualitative research Ability to research and combine data Proficiency in using Excel, Access, SPSS Proficiency in PowerPoint. Analytics experience Ability to translate data sets into insights and recommendations Good team player, detail- oriented, careful and willing to learn   Edelman is a global communications firm that partners with businesses and organizations to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Our 6,000 people in more than 60 offices deliver communications strategies that give our clients the confidence to lead and act with certainty, earning the trust of their stakeholders. Our honors include the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR; Advertising Age’s 2019 A-List; the Holmes Report’s 2018 Global Digital Agency of the Year; and, five times, Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work. Since our founding in 1952, we have remained an independent, family-run business. Edelman owns specialty companies Edelman Data & Intelligence (DxI) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).  For more information please visit: www.edelman.com  Please follow this link (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttuiKNaJLUI) to view a short video about life at Edelman. Show more Show less"]

But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry. title: Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description: ['Why SoftwareONE?  SoftwareONE is a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions , headquartered in Switzerland . With an IP and technology-driven services portfolio , it enables companies to holistically develop and implement their commercial, technology and digital transformation strategies. This is achieved by moderniz ing applications and migrate critical workloads on public clouds , while simultaneously managing and optimizing the related software and cloud assets and licensing. SoftwareONE’s offerings are connected by PyraCloud , its proprietary digital platform, which provides customers with data-driven, actionable intelligence . With around 7,700 employees and sales and service delivery capabilities in 90 countries, SoftwareONE provides around 65,000 business customers with software and cloud solutions from over 7,500 publishers . SoftwareONE’s shares (SWON) are listed on SIX Swiss Exchange. For more information, please visit https://www.softwareone.com/e .  SoftwareONE Holding AG, Riedenmatt 4, CH-6370 Stans  The role  Responsibilities  · Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.  · Managing users and user roles.  · Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary.  · Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.  · Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.  · Helping develop reports and analysis.  · Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.  · Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.  · Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.  · Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.  · Generating reports from single or multiple systems.  · Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.  · Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.  · Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.  · Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.  Requirements  What we need to see from you  · Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in computer science.  · 3+ years of experience as a data analyst or in a related field.  · Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.  · Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.  · Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.  · High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases.  · Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.  · Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.  · High-level written and verbal communication skills.  Show more Show less']

title: Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ['In TikiNOW Smart Logistic (TNSL), we sharply focus on providing solutions for fulfillment & delivery - the two critical pieces inside Tiki end-to-end ecommerce ecosystem. We aim for best-in-class services with efficiency in our Warehouse processes, Supply Chain and Cost management. We believe in growing a sustainable business with strong fundamentals, data-driven & advanced optimizations to enable all of those.  As a member of the Data Platform team, our mission is to build up the platform of data that enables people to make decisions & take actions with data-driven. Our work involves in areas such as finance, inventory management, fulfillment, delivery or even after-sale service to enable teams across the organizations to build up analytical products & advanced optimizations solutions. Our goal is to help maximize the value of each domain contributed to the customer & company.  We are looking for a Data Analyst to stand together with us and take responsibility for building and developing a strong analytic organization to help us understand customers, business across and make the right decision at the right time.  What will you do?  Understand the logic of data. Interpret and analyze data using statistical techniques to provide ongoing reports. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Acquire data from multiple data sources, understand and maintain the flow of data from origin to data warehouse. Work closely with software engineers to design systems that are friendly for tracking & logging data. Be a brother-in-arms with Product Manager to find out core metrics to drive product. Break down metrics into data points that are track-able. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Provide useful insights from data for making toughest and vital decisions. Corporate with Data scientists to clarify the logic of AI signals, find out available data sources and implement the pipeline to drive data and aggregate signals.  Requirements  Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL), programming (R) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, R etc) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Good at leadership skill (training, coaching skill...) BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics  Our attractive offers include:  Competitive salary and performance review, 13th-month pay based on performance. Open communication with passionate and experienced members. Challenging working environment. Easy access to the library with tons of startup, product, UX, coding... books. Private healthcare insurance. Annual health check-ups. Special internal programs for Tikiers when shopping on Tiki.vn (free ship TikiNow service, discount...). Internal events to bond our mutual understanding & spirit such as team building, team outing, Tiki‘s birthday, year-end party... New & beautiful office with a pantry room (with bar), entertainment & gymnastic equipment, yoga rooms, a library and an open space facilitating cross-department communication. Show more Show less']

Develop and maintain various dashboards based on business needs from functional stakeholders. Interpret and analyze data, visualize results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. Consistently improve the quality and usefulness of data on an ongoing basis. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for more insights. Excellent in logical thinking, problem-solving, and proven familiarity with big data. Strong analytical and reporting skills. Benefits  Competitive base salary + 13th-month bonus 14 annual leave days Private Health Insurance Annual Performance Review Company-wide bonding activities & gifts Dynamic, fun international work environment Opportunity to create content that is read by millions of readers domestically and internationally Access to meet and collaborate with experts and brands; just take a look at the content on Vietcetera to see for yourself Show more Show less']

LI_VNM Show more Show less']

title: Commercial Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ["Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  Responsibilities  As a Commercial Data Analyst, your duties & responsibilities are: Perform statistical modeling and analysis of structured and unstructured datasets to develop metrics, reports and visualizations of trends and patterns. Analyze data, draw insights, and present results in a cohesive, intuitive, and simplistic manner to executive management Identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities throughout the data life cycle Mine data, clean data to devise and optimize our algorithms, models’ accuracy Standardize reports, centralize analysis format to enrich our knowledge repositories Training end-users on new reports and dashboards Communicate and align with stakeholders on purpose and impact of analytical solutions on business.  Competencies Required  Data analysis – the ability to assess data sets and identify patterns and opportunities for improvement is commercial analyst’s primary skill Presentation skills – commercial analysts need to present their findings, along with forecasts and projections, to executives and management personnel, so effective presentation skills are a necessity Team coordination – because they work with sales teams and internal operation to drive revenue growth, commercial analysts need to coordinate team activities Communication skills – commercial analysts rely heavily on both written and verbal communication to work with departments and personnel across teams and business lines  Requirement  Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business or related degree. Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical abilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to compose and present reports, findings and presentations Having extensive computer knowledge including its software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc) Has SQL, Python experience is a plus  Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. title: Junior CSR Data Analyst

In this role, we not only need you to be able to acquire and analyse data, but just as importantly, we seek for a person being able to summarise it, visualise it and create compelling presentations based on the information gathered. title: Data Analyst - Vietnam
description: ["Description  Your work makes the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away or reaching it just in time. We feel a great sense of responsibility at Citymapper. Millions of users around the world trust our green app to be on time for work, a job interview or a date.  As one of our Data Analysts you will build the timetable data that powers the Citymapper app and help launch new cities. You'll use secret magic (and our internal tools) to transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information whilst building, validating, and shipping data directly to users on a daily basis.  Working with our engineers to improve tools and automate tasks, you'll manage data in a range of cities across different formats.  This role is designed for contractors based in Vietnam.  We are a diverse team of transport enthusiasts from all around the world with extensive language skills, who are not afraid to get our hands dirty with transit data. Join us for the ride!  We love languages here at Citymapper, but for the purposes of this role, please submit your application in English.  Requirements  The position is open to applicants with all levels of experience as we'll teach you the technical skills to succeed. You'll need:  A true passion for public transport and cities, good understanding of how public transport networks operate. A technical mindset, comfortable dealing with data, willingness to learn new data skills. A hands-on, proactive, practical, pragmatic attitude. An exceptional attention to detail with good organisational skills. Some familiarity with common transit data formats or data-wrangling is a plus (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, JSON, XML etc) Vietnamese language skills a plus.  Benefits  Contractor position in a remote-first team. Working on something interesting and meaningful - helping to make cities usable. Working with a not-too-big, diverse engineering team. Arcane public transport knowledge with which to dazzle your friends.  We believe that diverse teams are the best teams and we're proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of age, disability, gender re-assignment, marriage, pregnancy, maternity, race or nationality, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation (and any other status protected by applicable law) Show more Show less"]

title: Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ["Make A Real Difference At PropertyGuru.  Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.  At PropertyGuru Group, we believe that every person – no matter what their circumstance – should have a place to call home. That’s why we’ve been on a mission to transform how people find, finance and own home across Southeast Asia over the last 13 years.  Voted by property seekers as “Asia’s Most Influential Brand for Online Property Search”, PropertyGuru enables real-world aspirations through digital transformation and constant innovation. Every day, the work that we do has a real and positive impact on thousands of lives.  As an employee, you’ll be empowered by our community work culture, where everyone has the autonomy, support and resources to do the best work of their careers. As we evolve our journey to help people make confident property decisions, we stay true to our core values to guide the way we work and the decisions we make every step of the way: we own it and deliver it, we have fun and celebrate success, we respect and care for each other, we push beyond good, and we create what’s next.  Data Analyst  Our Data Analytics team is empowered to build unique and compelling products/users/business insights using machine learning and data. The work done by our Data Analysts is highly sought after as the business sees the Data Analysts as partners in their journey who drive and create a tremendous impact on the business.  What you will do?  You will be working collaboratively to use data to positively inform and influence the business decisions at PropertyGuru. You will use the data to create compelling narratives to help drive action. For example, why do certain property listings get significantly higher page views than their peers? What actions do consumers/users browsing on the property take before they zero in on the right property? These are some of the many questions that get asked of our data analyst team in PropertyGuru. These questions drive our product development decisions and inform and recommend action items for the marketing and advertising campaigns. You will also be taking part to evaluate and report the key business metrics for the businesses. You will spend time understanding the drivers of the metrics to help the stakeholders understand the potential reasons and hypotheses for the changes. Some of these are related to the A/B experimentations that are performed on the users and products as part of their development. Since most of these analyses are driving important decisions, you will need to ensure that these analyses are repeatable and accessible to all with appropriate documentation.  Required  Requirements  Minimum 3+ years of industry experience in working with large-scale datasets. English language fluency is a must. Knowledge of SQL is a must. You will need to write custom queries to pull data from BigQuery to support your analyses and hypothesis. Build clear and simple dashboards and presentations. We currently use Tableau and Looker for reporting and visualizations.  Optional  Communicate clearly and effectively to cross-functional business partners of varying technical levels Experience working with Google Analytics is a plus. Experience in Python, R, C++, Java, Go, Scala is a plus. This is not a must-have requirement, but good to have if you aspire to grow as a data analyst or eventually grow into a data science role. Bachelor's degree in IT or relevant field. Alternatively, lesser qualifications with strong experience in data analysis will also be considered.  PropertyGuru Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative and learning environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to gender, identity, race, religion, nationality, age, marital status, disability, or any other protected status, per applicable law. If there is anything we can do to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  For a full listing of our jobs, visit https://careers.propertygurugroup.com Show more Show less"]

title: Performance and Data Analyst
description: ['Position: Performance and Data Analyst  Report to: Chief Risk Officer     Introduction:  Our client is a well-established independent asset manager with some US$ billion in listed equity, clean-tech, fixed income and real estate for international pension and sovereign wealth funds and endowments. They are now searching for a Performance and Data Analyst based in HCM city to work with the Chief Risk Officer.     Main Job Purpose  Produce and oversee the accurate and timely delivery of investment performance figures across the organization. Build analytical reports and provide automated solutions for complex workflows within the Risk department.  Key responsibilities  · Performance  o Oversee the performance and risk systems within the department and manage complex works flows  o Review and ensure accurate production of performance returns and analytical information across portfolios  o Investigate and resolve return differences by working with systems vendors and various departments  o Interpret and explain performance attribution results  o Build and prepare analytical performance reports  · Data Analysis  o Build analytical solutions and visualizations within the department including trending statistics and outlier reports  o Work with departments to identify data sources and pull information to build consolidated data sets  o Provide automated solutions within the department  o Manage complex workflows, data sets and time series information     Skills and qualification required  · Holds an undergraduate degree or master’s degree in computer science, math, engineering, auditing, or business  · Must be able to code in SQL, R and/or Python and demonstrate the level of ability  · Must have strong analytical skills, attention to detail and can work under tight deadlines  · Understanding of financial markets and investment management is a plus  · Understanding of fund accounting, performance calculation methodologies is a plus  · Must be proficient in English and Vietnamese  Experience required  · At least 5 years of experience in the fields of financial, banking, securities, or information technology     Interested candidates please contact Mr Vinh Nguyen, Senior Recruitment Consultant at vinh.nguyen@sperton.com  Note: This position is only open to local candidates, and we shall be contacting shortlisted candidates, apology for that. title: Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ["At GeoComply, our mission is to empower the future of digital trust. We operate at the center of a new generation of cybersecurity companies, leveraging today's geolocation data to make better risk-based decisions. Working as a critical piece of the security infrastructure for some of the world’s largest tech companies like DraftKings, FanDuel, the BBC and Akamai, we are the global market-leader for compliance-grade geolocation data and a critical piece of the decision engine. We have big plans in the next few years, including a targeted US IPO and various M&A opportunities.  At the heart of it all is people - we are deeply committed to creating and sustaining a world-class experience for our employees, customers, and partners.  Job Summary  We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in HCMC, Vietnam who will match our ambitions , and help us Better ourselves and achieve our goals.  The Data Analyst contributes to GeoComply’s success by providing managers with intel regarding the suspicious cases based on information and data gathered through the back office of our systems. This position reports to DA Lead on a day-to-day basis.  What You Will Be Doing  Perform manual data analysis and visualization on live production data for detection of geolocation data anomalies and anti-fraud purposes Design and script reports based on technical and business requirements Monitor release, configuration, and database changes Contribute to the growth of the team by suggesting ideas and new practices to improve manual review methodologies. Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of the company’s technologies, processes, and teams Understand the company’s vision, goals and strategy; actively contribute to the achievement of the goals and execution of the company’s strategy  About You  At least 2 years of experience in a relevant field Bachelor degree with good results in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Information Systems, Finance, Commerce, Economics, Statistics or similar majors Good command in Microsoft Excel Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work in small collaborative teams in a dynamic working environment Good communication and interpersonal skills when working with the team Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents (software requirements and design specifications, standards, and regulations). Ability to work under tight timelines Intermediate written and spoken technical English, enough to discuss issues with teams remotely  Bonus Points if You  Sound experience in performing both QA testing and data analytics; the ability to look beyond testing tasks and think ‘outside the box’ Comfortable with Android, iOS, macOS, and Windows is a plus Enjoy working with numerical data Knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL etc), visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Kibana) is a plus  Our Benefits  Competitive Salary: High salary and attractive bonus system (13th month, business performance, dividend and internal shares program) Learning & Development: We provide an annual budget equal to 1-months’ salary that can go towards professional or personal development or sport. Equity Plan: As employees of GeoComply, we’re all “owners”. Our unique equity and bonus plans give you the opportunity to share in our company’s success. Fast career path within the company. Premium healthcare insurance (Bao Viet/Liberty) 20 days annual leave Weekly English classes with a native teacher Modern stand-alone office building in the center of Saigon. Free motorbike parking. We're always stocked up on snacks and coffee and have free lunches monthly Frequent social and team-building events  At GeoComply, we live our value of building it right. Our workplace is built on mutual respect and inclusion. We know that diversity of experience and thought has led to connection, innovation, and our company’s success. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, beliefs, and identities.  Now What? Send us your resume and a cover letter. We Can’t-Wait To Meet You. Show more Show less"]

title: Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ['MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC  Mô tả công việc Tham gia xây dựng, kiểm thử, triển khai, vận hành và kiểm định các mô hình thẻ điểm và mô hình xếp hạng tín dụng khách hàng (scorecard) Cập nhật thường xuyên các kết quả của hệ thống Thu hồi nợ (Collection), hệ thống cảnh báo sớm (EWS) về những khách hàng vi phạm quy định cho vay, các khách hàng cần cảnh bảo sớm để có những điều chỉnh và định hướng chính sách tín dụng qua việc phân tích dữ liệu Giám sát và phân tích hiệu quả các chính sách cho vay các sản phẩm, quy trình ra quyết định cho vay qua việc phân tích dữ liệu Xây dựng các mô hình, báo cáo để giám sát chất lượng của các bộ phận tham gia vào các quy trình liên quan đến việc phê duyệt tín dụng YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC Yêu cầu: Trình độ học vấn: Tốt nghiệp đại học các chuyên ngành kế toán – kiểm toán, kinh tế, tài chính… Các Kinh nghiệm liên quan Tối thiểu 3 năm kinh nghiệm về kiểm toán, quản trị rủi ro,…hoặc kinh nghiệm BI Developer Có kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực tài chính tiêu dùng là một lợi thế Có khả năng làm việc dưới môi trường thay đổi nhanh, cường độ cao Ưu tiên ứng viên có kinh nghiệm tương đương tại các tổ chức tài chính/Big4… Các Kỹ năng Yêu cầu bắt buộc: Có khả năng Sử dụng thành thạo các công cụ phân tích dữ liệu như SQL, Python, Power BI… Quản lý thời gian, quản lý đội nhóm Kỹ năng giao tiếp Phân tích, tổng hợp và xử lý vấn đề Có kiến thức về thống kê, định lượng Nhanh nhạy với các con số Quyền lợi Lương thưởng + chế độ: Lương thỏa thuận hấp dẫn + lương KPIs (theo tháng) Thưởng cuối năm + thưởng Lễ/Tết + thưởng sinh nhật + thưởng đột xuất khi hoàn thành tốt nhiệm vụ. BHXH + bảo hiểm chăm sóc sức khỏe cho nhân viên (F88 Care) Môi trường làm việc: Cơ hội làm việc tại Công ty Fintech về dịch vụ tài chính với hơn 400 PGD trên 63 Tỉnh/ Thành phố. Được làm việc trong môi trường trẻ năng động, luôn coi Con người là yếu tố trọng tâm để phát triển Môi trường làm việc cởi mở và năng động với các giá trị cốt lõi sâu sắc truyền cảm hứng làm việc đến nhân viên. Khuyến khích trao đổi ý tưởng, đề cao sự sáng tạo trong công việc. Cơ hội tham gia gắn kết với tập thể thông qua các hoạt động văn hóa sôi động: Teambuilding, Tất niên, 8/3, 20/10, Giáng sinh… Thời gian làm việc: Từ 08h30 - 17h30, từ thứ 2 - thứ 6 Cơ hội phát triển: F88 cam kết cho bạn nền tảng vững chắc để học hỏi và phát triển. Tham gia đào tạo bài bản, chuyên nghiệp từ Học viện F Sẵn sàng trao quyền, cơ hội đột phá cho nhân viên Show more Show less']

title: Data Governance Analyst

industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking
description: ['Job Id: 22430426  The Business Analytics Analyst is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.  Responsibilities: Prepare presentation to provide highlights/updates regarding Data Quality, End User Computing, Data Control for Data Governance Forum Generate monthly Data Quality Scorecard and Data Management Tool Report timely and as per approved business rules Collaborate with relevant to identify critical data elements and design business rule for these data elements and register new critical data elements if any within approved Data Governance Framework Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to investigate and fix data quality which is not met our requirement Manage infrastructure and data warehouse to ensure data access right to be granted appropriately Collaborate with relevant stakeholders for data warehouse enhancement Identify opportunity to improve data capability to support business growth Perform parameter upload into Data Warehouse to ensure no impact on business Oversight on record management, risk & control assessment and data security matrix  Qualifications:  Minimum 2-3 years working experience in banking or financial services industry with experience in data warehouse management and data quality control Strong knowledge and ability to use Excel VBA, Access, SAS, SQL and other tools to support analytical methods, database management, and communication of results Working knowledge of business statistics, mathematical and data modeling processes Organized and possess excellent quantitative, analytical and communication skills Strong attention to detail and accuracy Good interpersonal skills and ability to work with all levels is required. Demonstrate sound project management and/or leadership skills Good project management  Education:  University degree holder in a quantitative field (e.g. Finance, Statistics or Business Administration, Information & Technology) or related discipline  This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.  Citi has entered into an agreement with United Overseas Bank (UOB Vietnam) to transfer its consumer bank in Vietnam which includes Cards & Loans, retail banking and insurance distribution. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.  Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. title: Data Analyst (Risk analytics)
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ["At GeoComply, our mission is to empower the future of digital trust. We operate at the center of a new generation of cybersecurity companies, leveraging today's geolocation data to make better risk-based decisions. Working as a critical piece of the security infrastructure for some of the world’s largest tech companies like DraftKings, FanDuel, the BBC and Akamai, we are the global market-leader for compliance-grade geolocation data and a critical piece of the decision engine. We have big plans in the next few years, including a targeted US IPO and various M&A opportunities.  At the heart of it all is people - we are deeply committed to creating and sustaining a world-class experience for our employees, customers, and partners.  Job Summary  The Data Analyst in our Risk Analytics team contributes to GeoComply success by holding on to best practices with data analysis and testing projects. We expect that the ideal candidate is hands-on, detail-oriented, highly motivated to help create data insights, and has the managerial skills to lead a data science team. Will be a plus, if you have experience working in short, agile, iterative development cycles and have a great passion for working in fast-paced development process environments. You will work closely with Data analytics and Risk Research teams. In addition, you will have the opportunity to influence the development plan directly, research, and develop your ideas for the product.  What You Will Be Doing  Test current and past anti-fraud features on both client and server sides Visualise data in Kibana Conduct research on location spoofing to help teams remain up to date on current practices Research geo-blocking bypass methods to reproduce location spoofing and find similar attempts in the production data Review reports, both internal and client reports, and appropriate SQL/Python scripts Organize data in an easily understandable format using graphs and pivot tables Collaborate with the Reporting & Data Analytics Teams in Vietnam Collaborate with Machine learning team in Ukraine Accurately report hours spent on tasks in Jira Follow best practices and processes established by the team Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of the company’s technologies, process and teams  About You  At least 1-2 years of work experience as Data Analyst; Education or training in a relevant field; Good Windows, MacOS, iOS, Android knowledge; Strong Python knowledge (NumPy, pandas,etc.); Intermediate to advanced proficiency in English (both verbal and written), with the ability to effectively communicate complex information in a simple manner; Strong interpersonal skills with ability to communicate and build relationships with internal and external stakeholders; Highly organized and detail-oriented; Ability to prepare reports and present findings; Strong ability to operate independently and make clear and thoughtful decisions;  Bonus Points if You  Have knowledge of Elasticsearch Have knowledge of Deltalake  Our IDEALS  Impact. At GeoComply your voice matters and your work and ideas have a direct impact on our business. Dynamic. We are a hyper-growth company with a fast-paced work environment that propels your professional and personal growth. Exposure. We have a flat hierarchy so you work closely with our executives and contribute to projects across teams. Acceptance. We believe in equal opportunity for all and welcome your unique contribution. Learning. We provide extensive training to our people so that you can develop new skills and achieve your career goals. Support. We help each other so that you feel supported and free to do your best work.  Our Benefits  Competitive Salary: High salary and attractive bonus system (13th month, business performance, dividend, and internal shares program) Learning & Development: We provide an annual budget equal to 1-months’ salary that can go towards professional or personal development or sport. Equity Plan: As employees of GeoComply, we’re all “owners”. Our unique equity and bonus plans give you the opportunity to share in our company’s success. Fast career path within the company. Premium healthcare insurance (Bao Viet/Liberty) 20 days annual leave Weekly English classes with a native teacher Modern stand-alone office building in the center of Saigon. Free motorbike parking. We're always stocked up on snacks and coffee and have free lunches monthly Frequent social and team-building events  At GeoComply, we live our value of building it right. Our workplace is built on mutual respect and inclusion. We know that diversity of experience and thought has led to connection, innovation, and our company’s success. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, beliefs, and identities.  Now What? Send us your resume and a cover letter. We Can’t-Wait To Meet You. Show more Show less"]

title: Senior Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ["Sieu Viet is one of the leaders of online recruitment platforms in Vietnam. We own popular sites such as ViecLam24h, TimViecNhanh, ViecTotNhat and MyWork. We’ve just started on our journey of transforming the entire organization, from products to culture. We are growing rapidly with a mission to become a companion to both job seekers and employers on their journeys, and to equip them with best-in-class tools that help them along the way.  Job brief:  You will play the role of consultant for internal teams to identify and solve their problems based on data. Your main immediate responsibilities include gaining a deep understanding of the current company operations, working with the team to analyze data, and building a data-driven culture for Company. Down the road, you will be analyzing our massive datasets of job posts and resumes to identify market gaps and value-added opportunities.  Responsibilities:  Own the entire data flow from business objectives → transactional databases → analytical data warehouse → dashboards → insights and machine learning models. Gather requirements, create detail plans, and conduct data analysis projects. Proactively follow partner's operations, and guide their action plans based on insights. Conceptualize, develop, and maintain dashboards and visualizations. Evaluate and define product and business metrics. Design, run and analyze trial experiments in both business and product domains. Partner with data warehouse team and data scientists to build high-quality data sets and machine learning models.   Requirements  Master in SQL, data analysis and data visualization skills using BI tools (Datastudio, GoogleSheets, etc.) Proficient with R would be a plus. Experienced with statistical analyses. From 3+ years’ experience in similar roles, and experience in tech companies would be advantageous. Excellent communication skills, ability to work with business and technical stakeholders Proactive problem solving, have an eye for detail. Understanding of supply-demand theory, platform growth hacking, and product development.   Who we are looking for?  “Attitude is more important than aptitude”: we greatly value people who possess the 3 personal traits:  Growth mindset Curiosity Automation   Benefits  Working environment:  Flexible working hours (Mon - Fri only), 15-day leaves/ year (12 Annual, 3 sick leaves). Flat, open, fast-paced working environment with the best support from stakeholders. Challenging working environment where every new idea is welcomed.   Benefits:  Attractive remuneration package (salary, allowance - lunch, parking, telephone, etc.). Fully compliant with Social Insurance (health, social, and unemployment). Extra Accident Insurance for all employees, Premium Health Care Insurance for Manager and above level. 13th-month policy, Incentives, Bonus - subject to company performance. Performance & Salary review twice per year. “Bonding Policy” – for team engagement. Company's congrats gifts on birthday, Wedding Day, Children's Day, Woman's Day, Independent Day, Company's birthday, and other special occasions. Annual Health Checkup (once per year). Variety of corporate events, from sports competitions, monthly birthday parties, team building to Year-End Party etc.   Why you should join us:  The opportunity to work in 2nd player in the HR Tech Market with huge ambition and mission in the labor market. A great chance to impact millions of Vietnamese life through job opportunities and more. Passionate & talented colleagues. Show more Show less"]

title: Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ['MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC Gene Solutions là công ty hàng đầu tại Việt Nam chuyên nghiên cứu, phát triển và ứng dụng các xét nghiệm gen tiên tiến nhất, cung cấp các dịch vụ xét nghiệm liên quan đến di truyền phục vụ sàng lọc, chẩn đoán bệnh và định hướng điều trị liên quan đến gen. Trong những năm qua, Gene Solutions có những bước phát triển và không ngừng đầu tư xây dựng đội ngũ R&D mạnh và xuất sắc, tập trung nghiên cứu và ứng dụng những công nghệ hữu ích đã được chứng nhận trên thế giới nhằm mang đến các xét nghiệm gen mới nhất với chất lượng tốt nhất và chi phí hợp lý nhất, tăng khả năng tiếp cận của người Việt Nam tới những xét nghiệm di truyền thiết yếu phục vụ cho việc phòng, khám và chữa bệnh, nâng tầm chất lượng khám chữa bệnh, đóng góp vào công cuộc nâng cao chất lượng dịch vụ y tế và sức khỏe cho cộng đồng. MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC Thiết kế, xây dựng và tối ưu hóa cơ sở dữ liệu cơ bản (chính xác, hiệu quả và bảo mật). Đảm bảo vận hành và duy trì quy trình lưu trữ và quản lý cơ sở dữ liệu chính xác và bảo mật. Tham gia xây dựng bộ quy tắc cho quy trình nhập liệu, lưu trữ và quản lý cơ sở dữ liệu. Theo dõi, tổ chức và quan sát dữ liệu thống kê từ cơ sở dữ liệu để báo cáo cho cấp quản lý. Theo dõi và đánh giá tiến độ các dự án triển khai cơ sở dữ liệu. YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC Chúng tôi đang tìm kiếm một người: Cử nhân hoặc kỹ sư các ngành công nghệ thông tin, toán tin ứng dụng, thống kê hoặc các chuyên ngành có liên quan. Có tối thiểu 1 năm kinh nghiệm về Data processing và Database, hoặc 1 năm kinh nghiệm lập trình có sử dụng kỹ thuật Database. Có kiến thức về ngôn ngữ lập trình sử dụng Database. Có hiểu biết về thiết kế Database với công cụ: mySQL, Access,... Có kinh nghiệm lập trình .NET hoặc PHP-MySQL xây dựng một web application Điểm cộng nếu có kinh nghiệm xây dựng phần mềm trên Power Platform của Microsoft (Power Apps, Power BI, Power Automate, SharePoint online) Có hiểu biết tốt về Microsoft 365 và công cụ thực hiện survey là một lợi thế. Có khả năng ghi chú và theo dõi công việc hay chương trình lập trình. Có khả năng làm việc nhóm tốt, giao tiếp tốt. Chịu được áp lực, có kỹ năng suy nghĩ độc lập và phân tích tốt. Mong muốn xây dựng các giá trị tích cực vì cộng đồng Show more Show less']

title: Business Data Analyst
place: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: ["At GeoComply, our mission is to empower the future of digital trust. We operate at the center of a new generation of cybersecurity companies, leveraging today's geolocation data to make better risk-based decisions. Working as a critical piece of the security infrastructure for some of the world’s largest tech companies like DraftKings, FanDuel, the BBC and Akamai, we are the global market leader for compliance-grade geolocation data and a critical piece of the decision engine. We have big plans in the next few years, including a targeted US IPO and various M&A opportunities.  At the heart of it all is people - we are deeply committed to creating and sustaining a world-class experience for our employees, customers, and partners.  Job Summary  The Business Data Analyst contributes to GeoComply’s success by developing reports for customers, providing them with intel regarding their users based on information and data gathered through the back office of our systems. This position reports the Business Data Analyst Lead on a day-to-day basis.  You are able to, and enjoy, working with multiple teams across locations, have good communication and interpersonal skills. You have experience working in short, agile, iterative development cycles and have a great passion for working in agile development process environments.  What You Will Be Doing  Utilize existing scripts/tools to acquire data from different sources and produce ad-hoc reports Manually review test reports Collaborate with internal teams to understand reporting requirements and derive key metrics Ensure that reports are up to standard in terms of both data quality and presentation Stay informed of database changes to ensure that reports are produced as expected Contribute ideas towards team development Apply team process in all tasks Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of the company’s technologies, processes, and teams  About You  Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and/or Google Spreadsheet (using pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.). Demonstrated skills in analytical thinking, problem-solving, and attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines. Experience with SQL. Experience with data processing using a programming language. Ability to work in small collaborative teams in a dynamic working environment English language skills: fluent in reading and writing, comfortable with listening and speaking. Collaborative and client-centric mindset. At least 2 years of experience in related fields.  Our IDEALS  Impact. At GeoComply your voice matters and your work and ideas have a direct impact on our business. Dynamic. We are a hyper-growth company with a fast-paced work environment that propels your professional and personal growth. Exposure. We have a flat hierarchy so you work closely with our executives and contribute to projects across teams. Acceptance. We believe in equal opportunity for all and welcome your unique contribution. Learning. We provide extensive training to our people so that you can develop new skills and achieve your career goals. Support. We help each other so that you feel supported and free to do your best work.  Our Benefits  Competitive Salary: High salary and attractive bonus system (13th month, business performance, dividend and internal shares program) Learning & Development: We provide an annual budget equal to 1-months’ salary that can go towards professional or personal development or sport. Equity Plan: As employees of GeoComply, we’re all “owners”. Our unique equity and bonus plans give you the opportunity to share in our company’s success. Fast career path within the company. Premium healthcare insurance (Bao Viet/Liberty) 20 days annual leave Weekly English classes with a native teacher Modern stand-alone office building in the center of Saigon. Free motorbike parking. We're always stocked up on snacks and coffee and have free lunches monthly Frequent social and team-building events  At GeoComply, we live our value of building it right. Our workplace is built on mutual respect and inclusion. We know that diversity of experience and thought has led to connection, innovation, and our company’s success. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, beliefs, and identities.  Now What? Send us your resume and a cover letter. We Can’t-Wait To Meet You. Show more Show less"]
